text.div:
FHIR Version: 3.0.2
Supported formats: json
Published:2019-01-04
Published by: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative

This profile defines the expected capabilities of NCDHC Data Hub server when conforming to the NCDHC Data Hub IG The capabilitystatement resource includes the complete list of actual profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported the Servers. Servers have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

RESTful Behavior

The NCDHC Data Hub Server SHALL:

  1. Support NCDHC Patient resource profile.
  2. Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of NCDHC Data Hub Profiles
  3. Implement REST behavior according to the FHIR specification
  4. Support json resource formats for all NCDHC Data Hub interactions.
  5. Identify the NCDHC Data Hub profile(s) supported as part of the FHIR Meta profile attributefor each instance.
  6. Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.

The NCDHC Data Hub Server SHOULD:

  1. Support json resource formats for all NCDHC Data Hub interactions.
Security:

NCDHC Data Hub Servers SHALL

  1. implement the OAuth 2.0 documented in this guide
  2. A server has ensured that every API request includes a valid Authorization token, supplied via:Authorization: Bearer {server-specific-token-here}
  3. A server has rejected any unauthorized requests by returning anHTTP 401Unauthorized response code.

Non NCDHC Profile Summary:

The below is the list of additional profiles supported by the NCDHC Data Hub.

Profile NameProfile TypeURL
BundleInternationalhttp://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/bundle.html
OperationOutcomeInternationalhttp://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/operationoutcome.html
CapabilityStatementInternationalhttp://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/capabilitystatement.html
PersonInternationalhttp://hl7.org/fhir/STU3/person.html
RelatedPersonAustralia Base Profilehttp://hl7.org.au/fhir/base/aubase1/StructureDefinition-au-relatedperson.html
OrganisationAustralia Base Profilehttp://hl7.org.au/fhir/base/aubase1/StructureDefinition-au-organisation.html
PractitionerAustralia Base Profilehttp://hl7.org.au/fhir/base/aubase1/StructureDefinition-au-practitioner.html
DeviceAustralia Base Profilehttp://hl7.org.au/fhir/base/aubase1/StructureDefinition-au-device.html

name: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative CapabilityStatement
title: National Children's Digital Health Collaborative CapabilityStatement
description: Capability Statement for National Children's Digital Health Collaborative

rest.documentation: Capability Statement for National Children's Digital Health Collaborative

security.description: NCDHC FHIR servers use standard OAuth 2.0 for Consumer interactions and JWT for provider interactions. Both Consumer and Provider interactsion are supported by Smart-On-FHIR Launch sequences

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the AuditEvent resource

interaction.documentation: Search AuditEvent details for a given search critriea as provided in the searchParam section
Create AuditEvent for each interaction happening in the Data Hub. This SHOULD be used by the Hub internally and SHOULD NOT be exposed EXTERNALLY.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Patient reference for which the AuditEvent instances should be fetched

searchParam.name: agent
searchParam.documentation: Identifier of who

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Time when the event was recorded. System SHALL support 'ge', 'le' and 'eq' search as per FHIR standard

searchParam.name: agent-role
searchParam.documentation: Agent role in the event

searchParam.name: action
searchParam.documentation: Type of action performed during the event

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Patient resource

interaction.documentation: Reads a Patient instance based on the input Patient.id
Retrieves the history of a particular Patient as per the document id (Patient.id) provided.
When a client searches patients with no search criteria, they get a list of all patients they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

Creates a new Patient in the Child Data Hub. Duplicates are not allowed. The server SHOULD return back the newly created resouce to the client. The server enforces use of 'Prefer' tag with value as 'representation'. This is only allowed for internal use during registration. This interface SHOULD NOT be exposed EXTERNALLY.
System allows updating a Patient instance. This is only allowed for internal use during update to Patient profile. This interface is not exposed to external

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Search Patient based on the identifier

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Observation instances

interaction.documentation: Reads an Observation instance based on the input Observation.id. The returned resource SHALL have an id element with a value that is the [id]
Retrieves the history of a particular Observation as per the document id (Observation.id) provided.
Returns a Bundle of Observation resources for the Patient in context.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The subject that the observation is about (if patient). This is requried if the search is not for the looged in user but for a patient that the logged in user has access to.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: The code of the observation type

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: The classification of the type of observation

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the MedicationStatement instances.

interaction.documentation: Reads an MedicationStatement instance based on the input MedicationStatement.id. The returned resource SHALL have an id element with a value that is the [id]
Retrieves the history of a particular Observation as per the document id (Observation.id) provided.
Returns a Bundle of MedicationStatement resources for the Patient in context.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The subject that the MedicationStatement is about (if patient). This is requried if the search is not for the looged-in user but for a patient that the logged-in user has access to.

searchParam.name: code
searchParam.documentation: Return statements of this medication code

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Returns statements of this category of medicationstatement

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Immunization instances

interaction.documentation: Reads an Immunization instance based on the input Immunization.id. The returned resource SHALL have an id element with a value that is the [id]
Retrieves the history of a particular Immunization as per the document id (Immunization.id) provided.
Returns a Bundle of Immunization resources for the Patient in context.

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: The subject that the Immunization is about (if patient). This is requried if the search is not for the looged in user but for a patient that the logged in user has access to.

searchParam.name: vaccine-code
searchParam.documentation: Vaccine Product Administered

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Composition instances

interaction.documentation: System allows user to read a particular Composition
System allows reading history of a Composition instance
Returns a Bundle of Bundle containing the Composition resources for the Patient in context.

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Reference to the Patient for whom the Composition should be pulled. If the reference is not provided in the request, system should try to pull the Composition instances associated to the logged in user (Patient associated to the access token)

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: Status of the Composition instances to fetch. The allowed values are final | amended

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Type code of the Composition instances to fetch

searchParam.name: class
searchParam.documentation: Class code of the Composition instances to fetch

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: Search by Composition instances editing time. The system should support 'ge','le','eq' searches as defined in FHIR

resource.documentation: Provide details on what can be done on the Bundle instances

interaction.documentation: System allows user to read a particular Bundle (FHIR Document)
System allows reading history of a Bundle instance
When a client searches Bundle with no search criteria, they get a list of all Bundle instances they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required
System allows creating a Bundle document instance.
System allows updating a Bundle document instance.
System allows deleting a Bundle document instance.

searchParam.name: composition.subject
searchParam.documentation: Reference to the Patient for whom the Bundle should be pulled. If the reference is not provided in the request, system should try to pull the Bundle instances associated to the logged in user (Patient associated to the access token). This field is mandatory when used by provider system.

searchParam.name: composition.status
searchParam.documentation: Status of the Bundle instances to fetch. The allowed values are final | amended

searchParam.name: composition.type
searchParam.documentation: Type code of the Bundle instances to fetch

searchParam.name: composition.class
searchParam.documentation: Class code of the Bundle instances to fetch

searchParam.name: composition.date
searchParam.documentation: Search by Bundle instances editing time. The system should support 'ge','le','eq' searches as defined in FHIR

document.documentation: FHIR Document Support for Newborn Delivery Health Interaction
